messages.msgSnippet: brooke, i guess that would make sense.  i told my dh about your mother s advise and he roared.  thanks for the laugh - it s good to laugh about one s
messages.messageBody:
brooke,

i guess that would make sense. i told my dh about your mother's 'advise' and
he roared. thanks for the laugh - it's good to laugh about one's upbringing.
my mom gives advise that is really off the wall and i just say 'umm
interesting' but we do live a good 3 day drive away:)
-susan
austin,tx

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Kim running about with scissors
messages.msgSnippet: Hey Kim, My mum and yours must have been sisters! UI heard all the same stuff when I was growing up not forgetting Make sure you have clean undies on in case
messages.messageBody:
Hey Kim,
My mum and yours must have been sisters! UI heard all the same stuff when I
was growing up not forgetting "Make sure you have clean undies on in case
you are hit by a car" Apparently that is standard triage procedure - Check
her blood pressure, vital stats and undies....these don't look fresh on
today Dr...Hmmm, well she will have to wait in the corridor then while I
tend to these deserving patients!!!"

Brooke

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Kim running about with scissors
messages.messageBody:
your mother is very cute:)
-susan

libbygirl wrote:

> Still ROFLMAO!! Kim, my mother told me when I had just started dating that
> if ever I thought I was going to be pressured into going too far with a boy,
> to make sure that I was wearing either really tatty undies or none because
> either way I would be embarrassed for him to find out!! LOL (actually, don't
> tell her but if ever I told a boy I wasn't wearing any, it seemed to have
> the opposite effect from that desired by my dear mother!!) BLUSH
>
> Brooke
